channel.title: Magic requiring runes
channel.description: How do i make it so that magic requires runes?

item.title: Magic requiring runes
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:12, topic:160117”]Ah, sorry. It did have an extra bracket at the end. Sorry for the trouble it caused you =S

So it should be

if (magicID == 1152) // Wind Strike { if(playerLevel[6] >= 0) { if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1)) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1))) { deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1); deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1); ProjectileSpellnpc(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 1); hitDiff = misc.random(2); //Damage } else { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 1 to cast this spell."); } }

if it doesn’t work, try this.

if (magicID == 1152) // Wind Strike { if(playerLevel[6] >= 0) { if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1)) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1))) { deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1); deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1); ProjectileSpellnpc(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 1); hitDiff = misc.random(2); //Damage } } else { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 1 to cast this spell."); } }[/quote]

None of those worked

ffs can someone help me im getting confunsled

Read full topic

item.title: Magic requiring runes
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Ah, sorry. It did have an extra bracket at the end. Sorry for the trouble it caused you =S

So it should be

if (magicID == 1152) // Wind Strike { if(playerLevel[6] >= 0) { if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1)) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1))) { deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1); deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1); ProjectileSpellnpc(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 1); hitDiff = misc.random(2); //Damage } else { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 1 to cast this spell."); } }

if it doesn’t work, try this.

if (magicID == 1152) // Wind Strike { if(playerLevel[6] >= 0) { if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1)) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1))) { deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1); deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1); ProjectileSpellnpc(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 1); hitDiff = misc.random(2); //Damage } } else { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 1 to cast this spell."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Magic requiring runes
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Dont mean to hijack but since this has todo with this topic…

if(magicID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell)
{
if(playerLevel[6] <= 94)
{
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 40)==true) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 40)==true) || (playerHasItemAmount(554, 60)==true))
{
sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell.");
deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 40);
deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 40);
deleteItem(555, getItemSlot(555), 60);
startAnimation(1979);
attackPlayersWithin(539, 20, 3);
hitDiff = 1 + misc.random(30);
inCombat();
PkingDelay = 15;
sendMessage("You freeze the enemy!");
//stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2);
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
}
else
{
sendMessage("Not enough runes to cast this spell");
}
else 
{
sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell.");
}
}

why does it say cannot have else without if? Both ifs are there, along with both elses

Read full topic

item.title: Magic requiring runes
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:4, topic:160117”]Change it to this. That only deletes the runes if it finds them, but always casts the spell.

if (magicID == 1152) // Wind Strike { if(playerLevel[6] >= 0) { if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1)) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1))) { deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1); deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1); ProjectileSpellnpc(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 1); hitDiff = misc.random(2); //Damage } else { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 1 to cast this spell."); } } }

Also, having the braces lined up like this makes them much easier to count.[/quote]

WTF this gave me 100 errors

Read full topic

item.title: Magic requiring runes
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Change it to this. That only deletes the runes if it finds them, but always casts the spell.

if (magicID == 1152) // Wind Strike { if(playerLevel[6] >= 0) { if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1)) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1))) { deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1); deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1); ProjectileSpellnpc(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 1); hitDiff = misc.random(2); //Damage } else { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 1 to cast this spell."); } } }

Also, having the braces lined up like this makes them much easier to count.

Read full topic

item.title: Magic requiring runes
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

if (magicID == 1152) { // Wind Strike if(playerLevel[6] >= 0) { ProjectileSpellnpc(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 1); hitDiff = misc.random(2); //Damage if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1) == true)) { deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1); deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1); } else { sendMessage("You need a magic lvl of 1 for this spell !"); } }

I have this is that good?

item.title: Magic requiring runes
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

This would be for Wind Strike

if((playerHasItemAmount(556, 1) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(558, 1) == true)) {
deleteItem(556, GetItemSlot(556), 1);
deleteItem(558, GetItemSlot(558), 1);

556 would be the air rune, 558 would be the mind rune. It would delete those runes, once you cast those spells. And to make it incase they don’t have those runes

add an } else if((!playerHasItemAmount…etc

You had to add the whole thing because you have the magic lvl incase they don’t have it and this, you could just put the magic lvl requirement, and put an:

} else {
sendMessage(“Not enough runes”);

since that would be the only possible outcome, since you have already defined if they don’t have the required level.

Read full topic
